thread.title: 'Let him go blind!' Yorkshire Ripper sparks fury as killer jumps queue for sight-saving op
thread.title_full: 'Let him go blind!' Yorkshire Ripper sparks fury as killer jumps queue for sight-saving op

title: 'Let him go blind!' Yorkshire Ripper sparks fury as killer jumps queue for sight-saving op
text:
REX • GETTY YORKSHIRE RIPPER: Peter Sutcliffe has caused after he was reportedly jumped a queue for op 
The 70-year-old had cataract surgery despite others waiting more than a year for the same procedure, according to The Sun. 
Sutcliffe was given 20 life sentences in 1981 for the murder of 13 women and attempted murder of seven others. 
Neil Jackson, whose mum Emily, 42, was Sutcliffe's second victim in 1976, said: "It's a disgrace. They should let him go blind." 
GETTY NOTORIOUS: Sutcliffe had cataract surgery “It's a disgrace. They should let him go blind” Neil Jackson 
Tory MP Alec Shelbrooke told The Sun: "Law-abiding citizens should get priority over those who are a stain on society." 
Taxpayers have forked out tens of thousands of pounds on his treatment and security for hospital visits. 
According to The Sun, the serial killer was chained to five guards as he was taken from HMP Frankland to Sunderland Eye Infirmary at the end of January. 
REX KILLER: He was given 20 life sentences in 1981 
Sutcliffe left the hospital wearing an eyepatch after a 45-minute procedure where his blurred right eye lens was replaced with an artificial one. 
He told a mate: "My sight has really improved. Now I will be about to see the TV, read and write letters." 
But he may yet need further surgery involving popping his eye out so the lump can be removed. The most notorious criminals of the world Monday, 11th January 2016 From Al Capone to The Krays, here are the most notorious criminals of the world. 1 / 11 SG Pablo Emilio Escobar Gaviria was a Colombian drug lord and trafficker. His cartel, at the height of his career, supplied an estimated 80% of the cocaine smuggled into the United States 
GETTY OPERATION: But he may yet need further surgery 
The Yorkshire Ripper was left blind in his left eye after an attack at Broadmoor psychiatric hospital in 1997. 
And in January , he was given 24-hour access to a "butler" in prison. 
The Ministry of Justice said they do not comment on individuals. Related articles
